2025-08-07 09:10:51
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed Phase 3 of the hotel ownership research. The script successfully accessed 3 additional sources (TripAdvisor, Hotels.com, and Expedia), collecting over 5GB of HTML content total. The code properly analyzed existing workspace data, conducted targeted research, and saved comprehensive results to JSON files. However, the research still hasn't identified the specific owner company of Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico - the management info extraction patterns didn't find concrete company names, and the Mexican hotel context data needs deeper analysis. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - substantial data collection completed but the core objective (identifying the owner company) remains unachieved. The workspace now contains 7 files with extensive HTML content that requires detailed analysis. Next step: Analyze the saved HTML files systematically to extract the actual owner/management company name, then proceed with researching that Mexico City-based company for founder details, CINETOP operations, and 2006 television partnerships. Recommend saving the lengthy research output to 'workspace/phase3_research_summary.txt' for future reference.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time from datetime import datetime print('=== GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 3 ===\n') print('Objective: Analyze saved data and conduct targeted research to identify owner company') print('Focus: Extract owner company from collected data and research Mexico City hotel companies\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what data we have workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): existing_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f'Files in workspace: {existing_files}\n') # Inspect the JSON research results file first json_files = [f for f in existing_files if f.endswith('.json')] for json_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING {json_file} ===\n') with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file), 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print('File structure:') for key, value in data.items(): if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())}') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}') else: print(f' {key}: {value}') print() # Look for successful research results if 'research_results' in data: successful_results = [r for r in data['research_results'] if r.get('status') == 'success'] print(f'Successful research results: {len(successful_results)}\n') for i, result in enumerate(successful_results, 1): print(f'Result {i}: {result["target_name"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Page title: {result.get("page_title", "Unknown")}') if result.get('ownership_keywords_found'): print(f' Ownership keywords: {result["ownership_keywords_found"][:5]}') if result.get('potential_companies'): print(f' Potential companies: {result["potential_companies"][:3]}') if result.get('keyword_contexts'): print(f' Keyword contexts ({len(result["keyword_contexts"])}):') for j, ctx in enumerate(result['keyword_contexts'][:2], 1): print(f' Context {j} ({ctx["keyword"]}): {ctx["context"][:100]}...') print() else: print('No workspace directory found - creating new one\n') os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Now let's conduct more targeted research for Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico print('=== TARGETED HOTEL OWNERSHIP RESEARCH ===\n') headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # More specific research targets targeted_research = [ { 'name': 'TripAdvisor Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico', 'url': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g150800-d152966-Reviews-Gran_Hotel_Ciudad_de_Mexico-Mexico_City_Central_Mexico_and_Gulf_Coast.html', 'expected': 'Management company information, ownership details' }, { 'name': 'Hotels.com listing', 'url': 'https://www.hotels.com/ho124706/gran-hotel-ciudad-de-mexico-mexico-city-mexico/', 'expected': 'Hotel group or management company' }, { 'name': 'Expedia listing', 'url': 'https://www.expedia.com/Mexico-City-Hotels-Gran-Hotel-Ciudad-De-Mexico.h124706.Hotel-Information', 'expected': 'Corporate ownership information' } ] new_research_results = [] for i, target in enumerate(targeted_research, 1): print(f'{i}. Researching: {target["name"]}') print(f' URL: {target["url"]}') print(f' Expected: {target["expected"]}') try: response = requests.get(target['url'], headers=headers, timeout=25) if response.status_code == 200: print(f' ‚úÖ Successfully accessed (Content: {len(response.content):,} bytes)') soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Get page title page_title = soup.find('title') title_text = page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'Unknown' print(f' üìÑ Page title: {title_text[:100]}...') # Save the HTML content filename = f'targeted_research_{i}_{target["name"].replace(" ", "_").replace(".", "_").lower()}.html' filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f' üíæ Saved HTML to: {filename}') # Extract and analyze text content page_text = soup.get_text() # Look for hotel management companies and ownership information management_patterns = [ r'(?i)(?:owned|operated|managed)\s+by\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+(?:Group|Hotels|Corporation|Corp|Company|Management|Hospitality))', r'(?i)(?:management|hotel)\s+(?:company|group)[:.]?\s*([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+)', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+(?:Hotels|Group|Corporation|Management|Hospitality))\s+(?:owns|operates|manages)', r'(?i)property\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+(?:Group|Hotels|Corporation|Company))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+(?:Hotels|Group|Corporation|Company))\s+property' ] found_management_info = [] for pattern in management_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() if len(company_name) > 3 and company_name not in found_management_info: found_management_info.append(company_name) # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 100) context = page_text[start:end].strip() print(f' üè¢ Found management info: {company_name}') print(f' Context: ...{context[:150]}...') # Look for specific Mexican hotel companies mexican_hotel_keywords = [ 'grupo hotelero', 'hotel group', 'cadena hotelera', 'hoteles', 'mexico city', 'ciudad de mexico', 'mexican', 'mexicano' ] mexican_context = [] page_text_lower = page_text.lower() for keyword in mexican_hotel_keywords: if keyword in page_text_lower: # Find sentences containing the keyword sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text) for sentence in sentences: if keyword in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 20: mexican_context.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence.strip()[:200] }) if mexican_context: print(f' üá≤üáΩ Found Mexican hotel context ({len(mexican_context)} items):') for ctx in mexican_context[:2]: print(f' {ctx["keyword"]}: {ctx["sentence"]}...') research_data = { 'target_name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': 'success', 'page_title': title_text, 'content_length': len(page_text), 'management_info_found': found_management_info, 'mexican_context': mexican_context, 'html_file': filename } new_research_results.append(research_data) else: print(f' ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}') new_research_results.append({ 'target_name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': 'http_error', 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error: {str(e)}') new_research_results.append({ 'target_name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) print() time.sleep(3) # Additional research on known Mexican hotel companies print('=== RESEARCHING KNOWN MEXICAN HOTEL COMPANIES ===\n') # Research major Mexican hotel companies that might own Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico mexican_hotel_companies = [ 'Grupo Presidente', 'Hoteles City Express', 'Grupo Posadas', 'NH Hotel Group Mexico', 'Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe' ] for company in mexican_hotel_companies: print(f'Researching: {company}') # Search for connection between the company and Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico search_query = f'"{company}" "Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico" owner management' print(f' Query concept: {search_query}') # Since we can't use SERPAPI due to rate limiting, we'll note this for manual research print(f' üìù Noted for manual verification: Does {company} own/manage Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico?') print() # Save all new research data targeted_research_summary = { 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_phase': 'Phase 3 - Targeted Hotel Ownership Research', 'objective': 'Identify specific owner company of Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico', 'total_targets': len(targeted_research), 'successful_accesses': len([r for r in new_research_results if r.get('status') == 'success']), 'research_results': new_research_results, 'mexican_companies_to_investigate': mexican_hotel_companies } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/targeted_hotel_research_phase3.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(targeted_research_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print('=== PHASE 3 RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n') print(f'Targeted research completed: {len(new_research_results)} targets processed') print(f'Successful data collection: {targeted_research_summary["successful_accesses"]} sources') print(f'Research data saved to: targeted_hotel_research_phase3.json\n') # Display consolidated findings print('=== CONSOLIDATED FINDINGS ===\n') all_management_info = [] all_mexican_context = [] for result in new_research_results: if result.get('status') == 'success': print(f'‚úÖ {result["target_name"]}:') if result.get('management_info_found'): print(f' Management info: {result["management_info_found"]}') all_management_info.extend(result['management_info_found']) if result.get('mexican_context'): print(f' Mexican context items: {len(result["mexican_context"])}') all_mexican_context.extend(result['mexican_context']) print() if all_management_info: unique_management = list(set(all_management_info)) print(f'üè¢ All unique management companies found: {unique_management}') print(f'\nüìÅ Total files in workspace: {len(os.listdir(workspace_dir))}') for filename in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('\nüéØ Next Steps:') print('1. Analyze HTML files for specific owner company mentions') print('2. Research identified management companies for Mexico City connections') print('3. Look for founder information and CINETOP operations') print('4. Investigate 2006 television expansion partnerships')
Execution Output

developer
2025-08-07 09:12:10
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime print('=== GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 4 ===\n') print('Objective: Deep analysis of collected HTML files to identify the owner company') print('Focus: Extract specific owner company name and prepare for founder/CINETOP research\n') # Set up workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # First, let's inspect what files we have and their sizes print('=== WORKSPACE INVENTORY ===\n') if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.html')] json_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Total files: {len(files)}') print(f'HTML files: {len(html_files)}') print(f'JSON files: {len(json_files)}\n') for file in sorted(files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {file}: {size:,} bytes') else: print('No workspace found - this is unexpected based on HISTORY') exit() print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR OWNER COMPANY ===\n') # Analyze each HTML file systematically owner_analysis_results = [] for html_file in sorted(html_files): print(f'Analyzing: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Enhanced patterns to find hotel ownership information ownership_patterns = [ # Direct ownership patterns r'(?i)(?:owned|operated|managed)\s+by\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Corp|Company|Management|Hospitality|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)property\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))\s+(?:owns|operates|manages)\s+(?:the\s+)?(?:Gran\s+Hotel|hotel)', # Management company patterns r'(?i)management\s+company[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)hotel\s+group[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)chain[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company))', # Mexican specific patterns r'(?i)grupo\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)\s+S\.A\.\s+de\s+C\.V\.', r'(?i)empresa\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', # Property information patterns r'(?i)¬©\s*([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.))', r'(?i)trademark\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)brand\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] found_companies = [] company_contexts = [] for pattern in ownership_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() # Clean up the company name company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) # Remove trailing punctuation company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) # Normalize whitespace # Filter out obviously wrong matches if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and not company_name.lower().startswith(('the ', 'this ', 'that ', 'and ', 'or ')) and company_name not in found_companies): found_companies.append(company_name) # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context }) # Look specifically for "Gran Hotel" mentions with company names gran_hotel_patterns = [ r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico[^.]*?([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))[^.]*?Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?propiedad\s+de\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?pertenece\s+a\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] gran_hotel_companies = [] for pattern in gran_hotel_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and company_name not in gran_hotel_companies): gran_hotel_companies.append(company_name) # Get context start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': 'Gran Hotel specific', 'context': context }) # Display findings for this file if found_companies or gran_hotel_companies: print(f' ‚úÖ Found potential owner companies:') all_companies = list(set(found_companies + gran_hotel_companies)) for i, company in enumerate(all_companies[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {company}') # Show most relevant contexts relevant_contexts = [ctx for ctx in company_contexts if 'gran hotel' in ctx['context'].lower()] if relevant_contexts: print(f' üìù Most relevant contexts:') for i, ctx in enumerate(relevant_contexts[:2], 1): print(f' Context {i}: {ctx["company"]}') print(f' {ctx["context"][:200]}...') print() else: print(f' ‚ùå No clear owner companies found') # Store analysis results analysis_result = { 'file': html_file, 'content_length': len(page_text), 'found_companies': found_companies, 'gran_hotel_specific': gran_hotel_companies, 'all_contexts': company_contexts, 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } owner_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') owner_analysis_results.append({ 'file': html_file, 'error': str(e), 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print() # Consolidate all findings print('=== CONSOLIDATED OWNER COMPANY ANALYSIS ===\n') all_found_companies = [] all_contexts = [] for result in owner_analysis_results: if 'found_companies' in result: all_found_companies.extend(result['found_companies']) all_found_companies.extend(result.get('gran_hotel_specific', [])) all_contexts.extend(result.get('all_contexts', [])) # Get unique companies and rank by frequency from collections import Counter company_frequency = Counter(all_found_companies) print('üè¢ ALL POTENTIAL OWNER COMPANIES (by frequency):') for company, count in company_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {count}x: {company}') print(f'\nüìä Total unique companies found: {len(company_frequency)}') print(f'üìä Total contexts analyzed: {len(all_contexts)}') # Look for most credible owner based on context quality print('\n=== MOST CREDIBLE OWNER ANALYSIS ===\n') credible_owners = [] for ctx in all_contexts: context_lower = ctx['context'].lower() # Score contexts based on credibility indicators credibility_score = 0 # High credibility indicators if 'gran hotel ciudad de mexico' in context_lower or 'gran hotel ciudad de m√©xico' in context_lower: credibility_score += 10 if any(word in context_lower for word in ['owned by', 'operated by', 'managed by', 'property of']): credibility_score += 8 if any(word in context_lower for word in ['grupo', 'corporation', 'company', 's.a.']): credibility_score += 5 if 'mexico city' in context_lower or 'ciudad de mexico' in context_lower: credibility_score += 3 # Negative indicators if any(word in context_lower for word in ['booking.com', 'tripadvisor', 'expedia', 'hotels.com']): credibility_score -= 5 if len(ctx['company']) > 50: # Very long company names are often extraction errors credibility_score -= 3 if credibility_score > 5: credible_owners.append({ 'company': ctx['company'], 'credibility_score': credibility_score, 'context': ctx['context'][:300] }) # Sort by credibility score credible_owners.sort(key=lambda x: x['credibility_score'], reverse=True) if credible_owners: print('üéØ MOST CREDIBLE OWNER COMPANIES:') for i, owner in enumerate(credible_owners[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {owner["company"]} (Score: {owner["credibility_score"]})') print(f' Context: {owner["context"]}...') print() else: print('‚ùå No highly credible owner companies identified from current analysis') # Save comprehensive analysis results final_analysis = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'analysis_phase': 'Phase 4 - Deep HTML Analysis for Owner Company', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'total_companies_found': len(all_found_companies), 'unique_companies': len(company_frequency), 'company_frequency_ranking': dict(company_frequency.most_common(20)), 'credible_owners': credible_owners[:10], 'detailed_results': owner_analysis_results, 'next_steps': [ 'Research top credible owner companies for Mexico City connections', 'Investigate founder information for identified companies', 'Search for CINETOP operations', 'Look for 2006 television expansion partnerships' ] } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/owner_company_analysis_phase4.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: owner_company_analysis_phase4.json') # Prepare for next phase based on findings if credible_owners: top_candidate = credible_owners[0] print(f'\nüéØ TOP OWNER CANDIDATE FOR NEXT PHASE:') print(f'Company: {top_candidate["company"]}') print(f'Credibility Score: {top_candidate["credibility_score"]}') print(f'\nüìã READY FOR PHASE 5: Research this Mexico City-based company for:') print(' 1. Founder information') print(' 2. CINETOP operations') print(' 3. 2006 television expansion partnerships') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è No clear owner company identified. May need alternative research approach.') print('Consider researching the hotel directly through Mexican business registries.') print(f'\nüìÅ Workspace now contains {len(os.listdir(workspace_dir))} files') print('Analysis complete - ready for founder and CINETOP research phase.')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code ran successfully through most of the analysis but crashed with a NameError on line 217 due to an undefined variable 'context_lower'. The script successfully analyzed 5 HTML files, found potential owner companies, and was making good progress toward identifying the hotel's owner company. The analysis found 14 unique potential companies with 'Gran Hotel' appearing 2 times as the most frequent match, and was building credibility scores when the error occurred. **PLAN** alignment: 70% - significant progress made in deep HTML analysis but the critical credible owner analysis section failed to complete. The error appears to be in a list comprehension where 'context_lower' should be 'ctx["context"].lower()'. The code successfully saved partial results to 'owner_company_analysis_phase4.json' before crashing. Recommended fix: Correct the variable reference in the credibility analysis section and re-run to complete the owner company identification, then proceed with founder and CINETOP research.
Python Code python
import os import json import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime print('=== GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 4 ===\n') print('Objective: Deep analysis of collected HTML files to identify the owner company') print('Focus: Extract specific owner company name and prepare for founder/CINETOP research\n') # Set up workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # First, let's inspect what files we have and their sizes print('=== WORKSPACE INVENTORY ===\n') if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.html')] json_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Total files: {len(files)}') print(f'HTML files: {len(html_files)}') print(f'JSON files: {len(json_files)}\n') for file in sorted(files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {file}: {size:,} bytes') else: print('No workspace found - this is unexpected based on HISTORY') exit() print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR OWNER COMPANY ===\n') # Analyze each HTML file systematically owner_analysis_results = [] for html_file in sorted(html_files): print(f'Analyzing: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Enhanced patterns to find hotel ownership information ownership_patterns = [ # Direct ownership patterns r'(?i)(?:owned|operated|managed)\s+by\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Corp|Company|Management|Hospitality|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)property\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))\s+(?:owns|operates|manages)\s+(?:the\s+)?(?:Gran\s+Hotel|hotel)', # Management company patterns r'(?i)management\s+company[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)hotel\s+group[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)chain[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company))', # Mexican specific patterns r'(?i)grupo\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)\s+S\.A\.\s+de\s+C\.V\.', r'(?i)empresa\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', # Property information patterns r'(?i)¬©\s*([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.))', r'(?i)trademark\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)brand\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] found_companies = [] company_contexts = [] for pattern in ownership_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() # Clean up the company name company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) # Remove trailing punctuation company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) # Normalize whitespace # Filter out obviously wrong matches if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and not company_name.lower().startswith(('the ', 'this ', 'that ', 'and ', 'or ')) and company_name not in found_companies): found_companies.append(company_name) # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context }) # Look specifically for "Gran Hotel" mentions with company names gran_hotel_patterns = [ r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico[^.]*?([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))[^.]*?Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?propiedad\s+de\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?pertenece\s+a\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] gran_hotel_companies = [] for pattern in gran_hotel_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and company_name not in gran_hotel_companies): gran_hotel_companies.append(company_name) # Get context start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': 'Gran Hotel specific', 'context': context }) # Display findings for this file if found_companies or gran_hotel_companies: print(f' ‚úÖ Found potential owner companies:') all_companies = list(set(found_companies + gran_hotel_companies)) for i, company in enumerate(all_companies[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {company}') # Show most relevant contexts relevant_contexts = [ctx for ctx in company_contexts if 'gran hotel' in ctx['context'].lower()] if relevant_contexts: print(f' üìù Most relevant contexts:') for i, ctx in enumerate(relevant_contexts[:2], 1): print(f' Context {i}: {ctx["company"]}') print(f' {ctx["context"][:200]}...') print() else: print(f' ‚ùå No clear owner companies found') # Store analysis results analysis_result = { 'file': html_file, 'content_length': len(page_text), 'found_companies': found_companies, 'gran_hotel_specific': gran_hotel_companies, 'all_contexts': company_contexts, 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } owner_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') owner_analysis_results.append({ 'file': html_file, 'error': str(e), 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print() # Consolidate all findings print('=== CONSOLIDATED OWNER COMPANY ANALYSIS ===\n') all_found_companies = [] all_contexts = [] for result in owner_analysis_results: if 'found_companies' in result: all_found_companies.extend(result['found_companies']) all_found_companies.extend(result.get('gran_hotel_specific', [])) all_contexts.extend(result.get('all_contexts', [])) # Get unique companies and rank by frequency from collections import Counter company_frequency = Counter(all_found_companies) print('üè¢ ALL POTENTIAL OWNER COMPANIES (by frequency):') for company, count in company_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {count}x: {company}') print(f'\nüìä Total unique companies found: {len(company_frequency)}') print(f'üìä Total contexts analyzed: {len(all_contexts)}') # Look for most credible owner based on context quality print('\n=== MOST CREDIBLE OWNER ANALYSIS ===\n') credible_owners = [] for ctx in all_contexts: context_lower = ctx['context'].lower() # Score contexts based on credibility indicators credibility_score = 0 # High credibility indicators if 'gran hotel ciudad de mexico' in context_lower or 'gran hotel ciudad de m√©xico' in context_lower: credibility_score += 10 if any(word in context_lower for word in ['owned by', 'operated by', 'managed by', 'property of']): credibility_score += 8 if any(word in context_lower for word in ['grupo', 'corporation', 'company', 's.a.']): credibility_score += 5 if 'mexico city' in context_lower or 'ciudad de mexico' in context_lower: credibility_score += 3 # Negative indicators if any(word in context_lower for word in ['booking.com', 'tripadvisor', 'expedia', 'hotels.com']): credibility_score -= 5 if len(ctx['company']) > 50: # Very long company names are often extraction errors credibility_score -= 3 if credibility_score > 5: credible_owners.append({ 'company': ctx['company'], 'credibility_score': credibility_score, 'context': ctx['context'][:300] }) # Sort by credibility score credible_owners.sort(key=lambda x: x['credibility_score'], reverse=True) if credible_owners: print('üéØ MOST CREDIBLE OWNER COMPANIES:') for i, owner in enumerate(credible_owners[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {owner["company"]} (Score: {owner["credibility_score"]})') print(f' Context: {owner["context"]}...') print() else: print('‚ùå No highly credible owner companies identified from current analysis') # Save comprehensive analysis results final_analysis = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'analysis_phase': 'Phase 4 - Deep HTML Analysis for Owner Company', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'total_companies_found': len(all_found_companies), 'unique_companies': len(company_frequency), 'company_frequency_ranking': dict(company_frequency.most_common(20)), 'credible_owners': credible_owners[:10], 'detailed_results': owner_analysis_results, 'next_steps': [ 'Research top credible owner companies for Mexico City connections', 'Investigate founder information for identified companies', 'Search for CINETOP operations', 'Look for 2006 television expansion partnerships' ] } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/owner_company_analysis_phase4.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: owner_company_analysis_phase4.json') # Prepare for next phase based on findings if credible_owners: top_candidate = credible_owners[0] print(f'\nüéØ TOP OWNER CANDIDATE FOR NEXT PHASE:') print(f'Company: {top_candidate["company"]}') print(f'Credibility Score: {top_candidate["credibility_score"]}') print(f'\nüìã READY FOR PHASE 5: Research this Mexico City-based company for:') print(' 1. Founder information') print(' 2. CINETOP operations') print(' 3. 2006 television expansion partnerships') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è No clear owner company identified. May need alternative research approach.') print('Consider researching the hotel directly through Mexican business registries.') print(f'\nüìÅ Workspace now contains {len(os.listdir(workspace_dir))} files') print('Analysis complete - ready for founder and CINETOP research phase.')
Execution Output
Code Output: === GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 4 === Objective: Deep analysis of collected HTML files to identify the owner company Focus: Extract specific owner company name and prepare for founder/CINETOP research === WORKSPACE INVENTORY === Total files: 7 HTML files: 5 JSON files: 2 hotel_ownership_research_results.json: 5,000 bytes hotel_research_1_wikipedia___gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html: 130,480 bytes hotel_research_5_booking.com_listing.html: 1,625,556 bytes targeted_hotel_research_phase3.json: 23,053 bytes targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html: 1,797,038 bytes targeted_research_2_hotels_com_listing.html: 2,179,449 bytes targeted_research_3_expedia_listing.html: 1,493,348 bytes === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR OWNER COMPANY === Analyzing: hotel_research_1_wikipedia___gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html Content length: 16,581 characters ‚úÖ Found potential owner companies: 1. developer
2025-08-07 09:13:29
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 5)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime print('=== GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 4 FIXED ===\n') print('Objective: Deep analysis of collected HTML files to identify the owner company') print('Focus: Extract specific owner company name and prepare for founder/CINETOP research\n') # Set up workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # First, let's inspect what files we have and their sizes print('=== WORKSPACE INVENTORY ===\n') if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.html')] json_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Total files: {len(files)}') print(f'HTML files: {len(html_files)}') print(f'JSON files: {len(json_files)}\n') for file in sorted(files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {file}: {size:,} bytes') else: print('No workspace found - this is unexpected based on HISTORY') exit() print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR OWNER COMPANY ===\n') # Analyze each HTML file systematically owner_analysis_results = [] for html_file in sorted(html_files): print(f'Analyzing: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Enhanced patterns to find hotel ownership information ownership_patterns = [ # Direct ownership patterns r'(?i)(?:owned|operated|managed)\s+by\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Corp|Company|Management|Hospitality|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)property\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))\s+(?:owns|operates|manages)\s+(?:the\s+)?(?:Gran\s+Hotel|hotel)', # Management company patterns r'(?i)management\s+company[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)hotel\s+group[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)chain[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company))', # Mexican specific patterns r'(?i)grupo\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)\s+S\.A\.\s+de\s+C\.V\.', r'(?i)empresa\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', # Property information patterns r'(?i)¬©\s*([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.))', r'(?i)trademark\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)brand\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] found_companies = [] company_contexts = [] for pattern in ownership_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() # Clean up the company name company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) # Remove trailing punctuation company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) # Normalize whitespace # Filter out obviously wrong matches if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and not company_name.lower().startswith(('the ', 'this ', 'that ', 'and ', 'or ')) and company_name not in found_companies): found_companies.append(company_name) # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context }) # Look specifically for "Gran Hotel" mentions with company names gran_hotel_patterns = [ r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico[^.]*?([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))[^.]*?Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?propiedad\s+de\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?pertenece\s+a\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] gran_hotel_companies = [] for pattern in gran_hotel_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and company_name not in gran_hotel_companies): gran_hotel_companies.append(company_name) # Get context start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': 'Gran Hotel specific', 'context': context }) # Display findings for this file if found_companies or gran_hotel_companies: print(f' ‚úÖ Found potential owner companies:') all_companies = list(set(found_companies + gran_hotel_companies)) for i, company in enumerate(all_companies[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {company}') # Show most relevant contexts relevant_contexts = [ctx for ctx in company_contexts if 'gran hotel' in ctx['context'].lower()] if relevant_contexts: print(f' üìù Most relevant contexts:') for i, ctx in enumerate(relevant_contexts[:2], 1): print(f' Context {i}: {ctx["company"]}') print(f' {ctx["context"][:200]}...') print() else: print(f' ‚ùå No clear owner companies found') # Store analysis results analysis_result = { 'file': html_file, 'content_length': len(page_text), 'found_companies': found_companies, 'gran_hotel_specific': gran_hotel_companies, 'all_contexts': company_contexts, 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } owner_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') owner_analysis_results.append({ 'file': html_file, 'error': str(e), 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print() # Consolidate all findings print('=== CONSOLIDATED OWNER COMPANY ANALYSIS ===\n') all_found_companies = [] all_contexts = [] for result in owner_analysis_results: if 'found_companies' in result: all_found_companies.extend(result['found_companies']) all_found_companies.extend(result.get('gran_hotel_specific', [])) all_contexts.extend(result.get('all_contexts', [])) # Get unique companies and rank by frequency from collections import Counter company_frequency = Counter(all_found_companies) print('üè¢ ALL POTENTIAL OWNER COMPANIES (by frequency):') for company, count in company_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {count}x: {company}') print(f'\nüìä Total unique companies found: {len(company_frequency)}') print(f'üìä Total contexts analyzed: {len(all_contexts)}') # Look for most credible owner based on context quality - FIXED VERSION print('\n=== MOST CREDIBLE OWNER ANALYSIS ===\n') credible_owners = [] for ctx in all_contexts: # Fix the variable reference error from previous version context_text = ctx['context'].lower() # Score contexts based on credibility indicators credibility_score = 0 # High credibility indicators if 'gran hotel ciudad de mexico' in context_text or 'gran hotel ciudad de m√©xico' in context_text: credibility_score += 10 if any(word in context_text for word in ['owned by', 'operated by', 'managed by', 'property of']): credibility_score += 8 if any(word in context_text for word in ['grupo', 'corporation', 'company', 's.a.']): credibility_score += 5 if 'mexico city' in context_text or 'ciudad de mexico' in context_text: credibility_score += 3 # Negative indicators if any(word in context_text for word in ['booking.com', 'tripadvisor', 'expedia', 'hotels.com']): credibility_score -= 5 if len(ctx['company']) > 50: # Very long company names are often extraction errors credibility_score -= 3 if credibility_score > 5: credible_owners.append({ 'company': ctx['company'], 'credibility_score': credibility_score, 'context': ctx['context'][:300] }) # Sort by credibility score credible_owners.sort(key=lambda x: x['credibility_score'], reverse=True) if credible_owners: print('üéØ MOST CREDIBLE OWNER COMPANIES:') for i, owner in enumerate(credible_owners[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {owner["company"]} (Score: {owner["credibility_score"]})') print(f' Context: {owner["context"]}...') print() else: print('‚ùå No highly credible owner companies identified from current analysis') print('\nüîç ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: Let\'s search for specific Mexican hotel company names') # Search for known Mexican hotel companies in the content known_mexican_companies = [ 'Grupo Presidente', 'Grupo Posadas', 'Hoteles City Express', 'NH Hotel Group', 'Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe', 'Best Western', 'Howard Johnson', 'Holiday Inn', 'Marriott', 'Hilton', 'Fiesta Americana', 'Camino Real', 'Krystal Hotels' ] found_known_companies = [] for result in owner_analysis_results: if 'error' not in result: # Re-read the HTML file to search for known companies filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, result['file']) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read().lower() for company in known_mexican_companies: if company.lower() in content: # Find context around the company mention soup = BeautifulSoup(open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8').read(), 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() # Look for the company in context company_pattern = re.escape(company.lower()) matches = re.finditer(company_pattern, page_text.lower()) for match in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() found_known_companies.append({ 'company': company, 'file': result['file'], 'context': context }) print(f' üè® Found {company} in {result["file"]}') print(f' Context: {context[:200]}...') print() break # Only show first occurrence per file except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error searching {result["file"]}: {str(e)}') if found_known_companies: print(f'\nüéØ KNOWN HOTEL COMPANIES FOUND: {len(found_known_companies)}') else: print('\n‚ùå No known Mexican hotel companies found in the content') # Save comprehensive analysis results final_analysis = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'analysis_phase': 'Phase 4 - Deep HTML Analysis for Owner Company (Fixed)', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'total_companies_found': len(all_found_companies), 'unique_companies': len(company_frequency), 'company_frequency_ranking': dict(company_frequency.most_common(20)), 'credible_owners': credible_owners[:10] if credible_owners else [], 'detailed_results': owner_analysis_results, 'next_steps': [ 'Research top credible owner companies for Mexico City connections', 'Investigate founder information for identified companies', 'Search for CINETOP operations', 'Look for 2006 television expansion partnerships' ] } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/owner_company_analysis_phase4_fixed.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: owner_company_analysis_phase4_fixed.json') # Prepare for next phase based on findings if credible_owners: top_candidate = credible_owners[0] print(f'\nüéØ TOP OWNER CANDIDATE FOR NEXT PHASE:') print(f'Company: {top_candidate["company"]}') print(f'Credibility Score: {top_candidate["credibility_score"]}') print(f'\nüìã READY FOR PHASE 5: Research this Mexico City-based company for:') print(' 1. Founder information') print(' 2. CINETOP operations') print(' 3. 2006 television expansion partnerships') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è No clear owner company identified from HTML analysis.') print('üìã RECOMMENDED NEXT APPROACH:') print(' 1. Search Mexican business registries for Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico') print(' 2. Research the hotel\'s corporate registration directly') print(' 3. Look for Mexican tourism industry databases') print(' 4. Search for the hotel in Mexican hotel association member lists') print(f'\nüìÅ Workspace now contains {len(os.listdir(workspace_dir))} files') print('Analysis complete - ready for next research phase.')
Execution Output

tester

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code ran successfully through most of the analysis but crashed with a NameError in the credible owner analysis section due to an undefined variable 'context_text'. The script successfully analyzed 5 HTML files (over 7GB total content), found 14 unique potential owner companies with 'Gran Hotel' appearing most frequently, and was building credibility scores when the error occurred at line 218. **PLAN** alignment: 70% - substantial progress made in deep HTML analysis but the critical credible owner identification failed to complete. The code successfully inventoried the workspace, analyzed HTML files with advanced regex patterns, and consolidated findings before the variable reference error. The error appears to be in the credible owner analysis loop where 'context_text' should be 'ctx["context"].lower()'. Recommended fix: Correct the variable reference in the credible owner analysis section (around line 218) and re-run to complete the owner company identification, then proceed with researching that Mexico City-based company for founder details, CINETOP operations, and 2006 television partnerships.
Python Code python
import os import json import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime print('=== GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 4 FIXED ===\n') print('Objective: Deep analysis of collected HTML files to identify the owner company') print('Focus: Extract specific owner company name and prepare for founder/CINETOP research\n') # Set up workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # First, let's inspect what files we have and their sizes print('=== WORKSPACE INVENTORY ===\n') if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.html')] json_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Total files: {len(files)}') print(f'HTML files: {len(html_files)}') print(f'JSON files: {len(json_files)}\n') for file in sorted(files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {file}: {size:,} bytes') else: print('No workspace found - this is unexpected based on HISTORY') exit() print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR OWNER COMPANY ===\n') # Analyze each HTML file systematically owner_analysis_results = [] for html_file in sorted(html_files): print(f'Analyzing: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Enhanced patterns to find hotel ownership information ownership_patterns = [ # Direct ownership patterns r'(?i)(?:owned|operated|managed)\s+by\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Corp|Company|Management|Hospitality|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)property\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))\s+(?:owns|operates|manages)\s+(?:the\s+)?(?:Gran\s+Hotel|hotel)', # Management company patterns r'(?i)management\s+company[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)hotel\s+group[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)chain[:\s]+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company))', # Mexican specific patterns r'(?i)grupo\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)\s+S\.A\.\s+de\s+C\.V\.', r'(?i)empresa\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', # Property information patterns r'(?i)¬©\s*([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.))', r'(?i)trademark\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)brand\s+of\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] found_companies = [] company_contexts = [] for pattern in ownership_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() # Clean up the company name company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) # Remove trailing punctuation company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) # Normalize whitespace # Filter out obviously wrong matches if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and not company_name.lower().startswith(('the ', 'this ', 'that ', 'and ', 'or ')) and company_name not in found_companies): found_companies.append(company_name) # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context }) # Look specifically for "Gran Hotel" mentions with company names gran_hotel_patterns = [ r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico[^.]*?([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))', r'(?i)([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Company|S\.A\.|SA))[^.]*?Gran\s+Hotel\s+Ciudad\s+de\s+M[e√©]xico', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?propiedad\s+de\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)', r'(?i)Gran\s+Hotel[^.]*?pertenece\s+a\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&.,]+)' ] gran_hotel_companies = [] for pattern in gran_hotel_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.group(1).strip() company_name = re.sub(r'[,.]$', '', company_name) company_name = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', company_name) if (len(company_name) > 3 and len(company_name) < 100 and company_name not in gran_hotel_companies): gran_hotel_companies.append(company_name) # Get context start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() company_contexts.append({ 'company': company_name, 'pattern': 'Gran Hotel specific', 'context': context }) # Display findings for this file if found_companies or gran_hotel_companies: print(f' ‚úÖ Found potential owner companies:') all_companies = list(set(found_companies + gran_hotel_companies)) for i, company in enumerate(all_companies[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {company}') # Show most relevant contexts relevant_contexts = [ctx for ctx in company_contexts if 'gran hotel' in ctx['context'].lower()] if relevant_contexts: print(f' üìù Most relevant contexts:') for i, ctx in enumerate(relevant_contexts[:2], 1): print(f' Context {i}: {ctx["company"]}') print(f' {ctx["context"][:200]}...') print() else: print(f' ‚ùå No clear owner companies found') # Store analysis results analysis_result = { 'file': html_file, 'content_length': len(page_text), 'found_companies': found_companies, 'gran_hotel_specific': gran_hotel_companies, 'all_contexts': company_contexts, 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } owner_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') owner_analysis_results.append({ 'file': html_file, 'error': str(e), 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print() # Consolidate all findings print('=== CONSOLIDATED OWNER COMPANY ANALYSIS ===\n') all_found_companies = [] all_contexts = [] for result in owner_analysis_results: if 'found_companies' in result: all_found_companies.extend(result['found_companies']) all_found_companies.extend(result.get('gran_hotel_specific', [])) all_contexts.extend(result.get('all_contexts', [])) # Get unique companies and rank by frequency from collections import Counter company_frequency = Counter(all_found_companies) print('üè¢ ALL POTENTIAL OWNER COMPANIES (by frequency):') for company, count in company_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {count}x: {company}') print(f'\nüìä Total unique companies found: {len(company_frequency)}') print(f'üìä Total contexts analyzed: {len(all_contexts)}') # Look for most credible owner based on context quality - FIXED VERSION print('\n=== MOST CREDIBLE OWNER ANALYSIS ===\n') credible_owners = [] for ctx in all_contexts: # Fix the variable reference error from previous version context_text = ctx['context'].lower() # Score contexts based on credibility indicators credibility_score = 0 # High credibility indicators if 'gran hotel ciudad de mexico' in context_text or 'gran hotel ciudad de m√©xico' in context_text: credibility_score += 10 if any(word in context_text for word in ['owned by', 'operated by', 'managed by', 'property of']): credibility_score += 8 if any(word in context_text for word in ['grupo', 'corporation', 'company', 's.a.']): credibility_score += 5 if 'mexico city' in context_text or 'ciudad de mexico' in context_text: credibility_score += 3 # Negative indicators if any(word in context_text for word in ['booking.com', 'tripadvisor', 'expedia', 'hotels.com']): credibility_score -= 5 if len(ctx['company']) > 50: # Very long company names are often extraction errors credibility_score -= 3 if credibility_score > 5: credible_owners.append({ 'company': ctx['company'], 'credibility_score': credibility_score, 'context': ctx['context'][:300] }) # Sort by credibility score credible_owners.sort(key=lambda x: x['credibility_score'], reverse=True) if credible_owners: print('üéØ MOST CREDIBLE OWNER COMPANIES:') for i, owner in enumerate(credible_owners[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {owner["company"]} (Score: {owner["credibility_score"]})') print(f' Context: {owner["context"]}...') print() else: print('‚ùå No highly credible owner companies identified from current analysis') print('\nüîç ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: Let\'s search for specific Mexican hotel company names') # Search for known Mexican hotel companies in the content known_mexican_companies = [ 'Grupo Presidente', 'Grupo Posadas', 'Hoteles City Express', 'NH Hotel Group', 'Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe', 'Best Western', 'Howard Johnson', 'Holiday Inn', 'Marriott', 'Hilton', 'Fiesta Americana', 'Camino Real', 'Krystal Hotels' ] found_known_companies = [] for result in owner_analysis_results: if 'error' not in result: # Re-read the HTML file to search for known companies filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, result['file']) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read().lower() for company in known_mexican_companies: if company.lower() in content: # Find context around the company mention soup = BeautifulSoup(open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8').read(), 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() # Look for the company in context company_pattern = re.escape(company.lower()) matches = re.finditer(company_pattern, page_text.lower()) for match in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() found_known_companies.append({ 'company': company, 'file': result['file'], 'context': context }) print(f' üè® Found {company} in {result["file"]}') print(f' Context: {context[:200]}...') print() break # Only show first occurrence per file except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error searching {result["file"]}: {str(e)}') if found_known_companies: print(f'\nüéØ KNOWN HOTEL COMPANIES FOUND: {len(found_known_companies)}') else: print('\n‚ùå No known Mexican hotel companies found in the content') # Save comprehensive analysis results final_analysis = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'analysis_phase': 'Phase 4 - Deep HTML Analysis for Owner Company (Fixed)', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'total_companies_found': len(all_found_companies), 'unique_companies': len(company_frequency), 'company_frequency_ranking': dict(company_frequency.most_common(20)), 'credible_owners': credible_owners[:10] if credible_owners else [], 'detailed_results': owner_analysis_results, 'next_steps': [ 'Research top credible owner companies for Mexico City connections', 'Investigate founder information for identified companies', 'Search for CINETOP operations', 'Look for 2006 television expansion partnerships' ] } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/owner_company_analysis_phase4_fixed.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: owner_company_analysis_phase4_fixed.json') # Prepare for next phase based on findings if credible_owners: top_candidate = credible_owners[0] print(f'\nüéØ TOP OWNER CANDIDATE FOR NEXT PHASE:') print(f'Company: {top_candidate["company"]}') print(f'Credibility Score: {top_candidate["credibility_score"]}') print(f'\nüìã READY FOR PHASE 5: Research this Mexico City-based company for:') print(' 1. Founder information') print(' 2. CINETOP operations') print(' 3. 2006 television expansion partnerships') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è No clear owner company identified from HTML analysis.') print('üìã RECOMMENDED NEXT APPROACH:') print(' 1. Search Mexican business registries for Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico') print(' 2. Research the hotel\'s corporate registration directly') print(' 3. Look for Mexican tourism industry databases') print(' 4. Search for the hotel in Mexican hotel association member lists') print(f'\nüìÅ Workspace now contains {len(os.listdir(workspace_dir))} files') print('Analysis complete - ready for next research phase.')
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 6)

Python Code python
import os import json import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime print('=== GRAN HOTEL CIUDAD DE MEXICO RESEARCH - PHASE 4 FINAL ===\n') print('Objective: Complete analysis to identify owner company and prepare for founder/CINETOP research') print('Focus: Fix previous errors and extract specific owner company name\n') # Set up workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Inspect workspace files first print('=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n') if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.html')] json_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Total files: {len(files)}') print(f'HTML files for analysis: {len(html_files)}') print(f'JSON research files: {len(json_files)}\n') # Show file inventory for file in sorted(files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {file}: {size:,} bytes') print(f'\nHTML files to analyze: {html_files}') else: print('No workspace found') exit() print('\n=== SYSTEMATIC HTML ANALYSIS FOR OWNER COMPANY ===\n') # Analyze HTML files with corrected logic analysis_results = [] all_potential_owners = [] all_owner_contexts = [] for i, html_file in enumerate(sorted(html_files), 1): print(f'{i}. Analyzing: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for ownership patterns - simplified and more reliable approach ownership_indicators = [ 'owned by', 'operated by', 'managed by', 'property of', 'management company', 'hotel group', 'hotel chain', 'grupo hotelero', 'empresa', 'corporation', 'corporaci√≥n' ] # Look for sentences containing ownership indicators sentences = re.split(r'[.!?\n]', page_text) ownership_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower().strip() if len(sentence_lower) > 20: # Only meaningful sentences for indicator in ownership_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower: ownership_sentences.append({ 'indicator': indicator, 'sentence': sentence.strip()[:300] # Limit length }) break # Only count each sentence once print(f' Found {len(ownership_sentences)} ownership-related sentences') # Look specifically for Gran Hotel mentions gran_hotel_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower().strip() if ('gran hotel' in sentence_lower and len(sentence_lower) > 15 and len(sentence_lower) < 500): gran_hotel_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f' Found {len(gran_hotel_sentences)} Gran Hotel mentions') # Extract potential company names using improved patterns company_patterns = [ r'\b([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+(?:Group|Hotels?|Corporation|Corp|Company|Management|Hospitality))\b', r'\bGrupo\s+([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+)\b', r'\b([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+)\s+S\.A\.(?:\s+de\s+C\.V\.)?\b', r'\b([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s&]+)\s+Hotels?\b' ] potential_companies = set() for pattern in company_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: company_name = match.strip() # Filter reasonable company names if (3 < len(company_name) < 50 and not company_name.lower().startswith(('the ', 'this ', 'that ')) and company_name not in ['Hotels', 'Group', 'Corporation', 'Company']): potential_companies.add(company_name) potential_companies = list(potential_companies) print(f' Extracted {len(potential_companies)} potential company names') if potential_companies: print(f' Top companies: {potential_companies[:3]}') # Store results for this file file_result = { 'file': html_file, 'content_length': len(page_text), 'ownership_sentences': ownership_sentences[:10], # Limit to top 10 'gran_hotel_sentences': gran_hotel_sentences[:5], # Limit to top 5 'potential_companies': potential_companies[:10], # Limit to top 10 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } analysis_results.append(file_result) all_potential_owners.extend(potential_companies) all_owner_contexts.extend(ownership_sentences) # Show most relevant findings for this file if gran_hotel_sentences: print(f' üìç Key Gran Hotel mentions:') for j, sentence in enumerate(gran_hotel_sentences[:2], 1): print(f' {j}. {sentence[:150]}...') except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') analysis_results.append({ 'file': html_file, 'error': str(e), 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print() # Consolidate findings across all files print('=== CONSOLIDATED ANALYSIS RESULTS ===\n') # Count company frequency from collections import Counter company_counter = Counter(all_potential_owners) print('üè¢ POTENTIAL OWNER COMPANIES (by frequency):') for company, count in company_counter.most_common(15): print(f' {count}x: {company}') print(f'\nüìä Statistics:') print(f' Total potential companies found: {len(all_potential_owners)}') print(f' Unique companies: {len(company_counter)}') print(f' Ownership contexts: {len(all_owner_contexts)}') # Look for the most credible owner based on context analysis print('\n=== CREDIBLE OWNER IDENTIFICATION ===\n') # Analyze contexts for credibility - FIXED approach credible_candidates = [] for result in analysis_results: if 'error' not in result: # Check Gran Hotel sentences for ownership clues for sentence in result.get('gran_hotel_sentences', []): sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for ownership indicators in Gran Hotel sentences for indicator in ['owned by', 'operated by', 'managed by', 'property of', 'grupo']: if indicator in sentence_lower: # Try to extract company name from this sentence for company in result.get('potential_companies', []): if company.lower() in sentence_lower: credible_candidates.append({ 'company': company, 'evidence': sentence[:200], 'file_source': result['file'], 'indicator': indicator }) if credible_candidates: print('üéØ MOST CREDIBLE OWNER CANDIDATES:') for i, candidate in enumerate(credible_candidates[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {candidate["company"]}') print(f' Indicator: {candidate["indicator"]}') print(f' Evidence: {candidate["evidence"]}...') print(f' Source: {candidate["file_source"]}') print() else: print('‚ùå No highly credible owner candidates found in Gran Hotel contexts') # Alternative approach: Search for known Mexican hotel companies print('\nüîç SEARCHING FOR KNOWN MEXICAN HOTEL COMPANIES:') known_mexican_hotels = [ 'Grupo Presidente', 'Grupo Posadas', 'Hoteles City Express', 'Best Western', 'Howard Johnson', 'Holiday Inn', 'Marriott', 'Hilton', 'Fiesta Americana', 'Camino Real', 'NH Hotel Group', 'Krystal Hotels', 'Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe' ] found_known_companies = [] for result in analysis_results: if 'error' not in result: filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, result['file']) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read().lower() for company in known_mexican_hotels: if company.lower() in content: found_known_companies.append({ 'company': company, 'file': result['file'] }) print(f' ‚úÖ Found {company} in {result["file"]}') except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error searching {result["file"]}: {str(e)}') if found_known_companies: print(f'\nüè® KNOWN HOTEL COMPANIES FOUND: {len(found_known_companies)}') for company_info in found_known_companies: print(f' - {company_info["company"]} (in {company_info["file"]})') else: print('\n‚ùå No known Mexican hotel companies clearly identified') # Save comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'analysis_phase': 'Phase 4 - Complete HTML Analysis for Owner Company', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'total_potential_owners': len(all_potential_owners), 'unique_companies': len(company_counter), 'company_frequency_ranking': dict(company_counter.most_common(20)), 'credible_candidates': credible_candidates[:10], 'detailed_file_results': analysis_results, 'summary': { 'status': 'Analysis completed', 'owner_identified': len(credible_candidates) > 0, 'next_phase_ready': len(credible_candidates) > 0 or len(found_known_companies) > 0 } } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/complete_owner_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: complete_owner_analysis.json') # Determine next steps based on findings if credible_candidates: top_candidate = credible_candidates[0] print(f'\nüéØ TOP OWNER CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED:') print(f'Company: {top_candidate["company"]}') print(f'Evidence: {top_candidate["evidence"]}') print(f'\nüìã READY FOR PHASE 5: Research {top_candidate["company"]} for:') print(' 1. Founder information') print(' 2. CINETOP operations') print(' 3. 2006 television expansion partnerships') # Save the identified owner for next phase owner_info = { 'identified_owner': top_candidate['company'], 'evidence': top_candidate['evidence'], 'source_file': top_candidate['file_source'], 'confidence_level': 'high' if 'owned by' in top_candidate['indicator'] else 'medium', 'next_research_targets': [ 'Founder information', 'CINETOP operations', '2006 television expansion partnerships' ] } with open(f'{workspace_dir}/identified_owner_company.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(owner_info, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ Owner company information saved to: identified_owner_company.json') elif found_known_companies: print(f'\nüè® PROCEEDING WITH KNOWN HOTEL COMPANY:') primary_company = found_known_companies[0]['company'] print(f'Company: {primary_company}') print(f'\nüìã READY FOR PHASE 5: Research {primary_company} for:') print(' 1. Founder information') print(' 2. CINETOP operations') print(' 3. 2006 television expansion partnerships') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è OWNER COMPANY NOT CLEARLY IDENTIFIED') print('üìã RECOMMENDED ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:') print(' 1. Search Mexican business registries for "Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico"') print(' 2. Research Mexican tourism ministry databases') print(' 3. Check Mexican hotel association member directories') print(' 4. Search for the hotel in Mexican corporate registration databases') print(f'\nüìÅ Analysis complete. Workspace contains {len(os.listdir(workspace_dir))} files') print('Ready to proceed with founder and CINETOP research phase.')
Execution Output

Analyzing: targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html Content length: 52,032 characters Found 1 ownership-related sentences Found 6 Gran Hotel mentions Extracted 47 potential company names Top companies: ['BEST Hotels', 'Check availabilityHotel', 'Star Hotels'] üìç Key Gran Hotel mentions: 1. 9 of 5 bubbles(352 reviews) Check availabilityGran Hotel Ciudad De Mexico4... 2. 3 of 5 bubbles(4,704 reviews) Check availabilityGran Hotel Ciudad De Mexico4... 4. Analyzing: targeted_research_3_expedia_listing.html Content length: 1,358 characters Found 0 ownership-related sentences Found 0 Gran Hotel mentions Extracted 2 potential company names Top companies: ['Accommodation & Cheap Hotel', 'Accommodation & Cheap'] === CONSOLIDATED ANALYSIS RESULTS === üè¢ POTENTIAL OWNER COMPANIES (by frequency): 3x: Gran 3x: Gran Hotel 1x: Majestic 1x: Redirected from Gran Hotel 1x: Majestic Hotel 1x: Redirected from Gran 1x: HomeHotelsMexicoMexico DFMexico CityGran Hotel 1x: Mexico Gran 1x: HomeHotelsMexicoMexico DFMexico CityGran 1x: Please inform Gran 1x: Guests at Gran 1x: RomanticFacilities of Gran Hotel 1x: Please inform Gran Hotel 1x: El Gran 1x: El Gran Hotel üìä Statistics: Total potential companies found: 77 Unique companies: 73 Ownership contexts: 3 === CREDIBLE OWNER IDENTIFICATION === ‚ùå No highly credible owner candidates found in Gran Hotel contexts üîç SEARCHING FOR KNOWN MEXICAN HOTEL COMPANIES: ‚úÖ Found Best Western in hotel_research_1_wikipedia___gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html ‚úÖ Found Howard Johnson in hotel_research_1_wikipedia___gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html ‚úÖ Found Marriott in targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html ‚úÖ Found Hilton in targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html ‚úÖ Found Fiesta Americana in targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html ‚úÖ Found Camino Real in targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html ‚úÖ Found Best Western in targeted_research_2_hotels_com_listing.html ‚úÖ Found Holiday Inn in targeted_research_2_hotels_com_listing.html ‚úÖ Found Marriott in targeted_research_2_hotels_com_listing.html ‚úÖ Found Marriott in targeted_research_3_expedia_listing.html ‚úÖ Found Hilton in targeted_research_3_expedia_listing.html üè® KNOWN HOTEL COMPANIES FOUND: 11 - Best Western (in hotel_research_1_wikipedia___gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html) - Howard Johnson (in hotel_research_1_wikipedia___gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html) - Marriott (in targeted_research_1_tripadvisor_gran_hotel_ciudad_de_mexico.html) -
